communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - Ocala
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to video footage from a police intervention, specifically from the body camera worn by the officer(s) and the dashcam of the police vehicles involved. Article:
https://www.clickorlando.com/news/local/2025/05/04/ocala-woman-accused-of-robbing-bank-arrested-within-minutes-police-say/

Exact date of incident: May 4, 2025
Names of parties involved: Christina Gates Thagard

I intend to use this footage solely for educational purposes to promote a better understanding of law enforcement procedures and the application of the law.

I understand that there may be associated costs for providing this footage, and I am more than willing to cover any fees incurred. Please inform me about the necessary procedures and the costs involved.

Thank you in advance for your assistance. I trust that this footage will be invaluable for my educational efforts, and I greatly appreciate your cooperation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

George Smith

communications.communication:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All available records of firearms seized, confiscated by or surrendered to the Richmond Police Department from 2012 to the present day.

Please include fields such as:
FIREARMS_MAKE
FIREARMS_MODEL
FIREARMS_CALIBER
RECOVERY_DATE (date seized or recovered)

Sincerely,

Andy Friedman

communications.subject: SLMPD - Public Records Request :: P025091-091025
communications.communication:
Dear Andy Friedman: 
Thank you for submitting a records request to the St. Louis Metropolitan Police Department.  Your request was given reference number P025091-091025, for tracking purposes. Type of Records Selected: Other Police Record Complaint Number (if applicable): Type of Incident (if applicable): Description of Request (if applicable):   To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All available records of firearms seized, confiscated by or surrendered to the St. Louis Metropolitan Police Department (SLMPD) from 2012 to the present day.

Please include fields such as:
FIREARMS_MAKE
FIREARMS_MODEL
FIREARMS_CALIBER
RECOVERY_DATE (date seized or recovered)
UCR_CATEGORY (associated crime or offense type)
Any additional firearm-specific attributes (e.g., serial number, type, manufacturer)

I am not requesting address or location data.

Please provide the records in machine-readable formats (e.g. CSV, Excel, or similar), including the full data schema or data dictionary.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andy Friedman

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fst-louis-metropolitan-police-department-671%252Fhistorical-gun-seizure-inventory-192920%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAj9WsQ4FuNTZD2Y9DnVAucV28%3A1uwXvO%3AzWjtUgZGNQk1CODmRgeTVdp0glllSCyMNOpKGpCXkUY 
We are currently reviewing your request and will contact you if any additional information is required.  Otherwise, we will proceed with locating and gathering responsive records from various departments.  Once records are located, they will need to be reviewed to determine what may be released at this time.  All records are released in accordance with the Missouri Sunshine Law, Chapter 610 and SLMPD Policy. 
There will be a cost associated with this request, and you will be contacted with more details prior to records being released.  The earliest records are typically available is as follows: 
• Arrest Reports, Background Checks, Crash Reports, Police Calls for Service, Law Enforcement Requests and Non-criminal Police Reports are available within 10 days of submission of your request. 
• Criminal Police Reports, evidentiary material and other non-standard requests are available within 30 days of submission. 
In the event your request will require additional time you will be provided with a detailed explanation of any further delay. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 
 
Thank you!

title: Library Contract Request: Oxford English Dictionary Online (Lewis-clark State College)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Idaho Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) The most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with Oxford University Press relating to the licensing of the Oxford English Dictionary (OED) Online;
2) All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and
3) All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the contractual relations with Oxford University Press for OED licensing. 

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of Oxford English Dictionary (OED) Online.

Please do not limit your search to strictly direct agreements or renewals between the institution and Oxford University Press, but include all agreements and related documentation through consortia such as the INLAN Consortium or Lyrasis.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ellen Dubinsky

title: ALPR Hot Lists (Spokane County Sheriff's Office)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1.	A description of all “hot lists” or “custom hot lists” currently maintained for use in Automated License Plate Reader (ALPR) systems.
2.	Any policies, agreements, or data-sharing documents identifying external data sources used to populate those lists (e.g., DMV data on suspended/revoked licenses, NCIC, CLETS, Amber Alerts, stolen vehicle databases).
3.	The criteria under which plates are added or removed from hot lists.

Please provide documents in native electronic form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

We request the following records related to Automated License Plate Readers ("ALPRs") and your law enforcement agency ("Agency").

Part A - Information related to ALPR data sharing.

A1. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares ALPR data;
A2. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives ALPR data;
A3. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares “hot list” information;
A4. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives “hot list” information.

The information requested in items A1-A4 is readily available for extraction through the ALPR software you use. For example, with Vigilant Solutions/Motorola Solutions, this data can be exported easily using the Data Sharing Report function. With Flock Safety, this information is available through the transparency portal function. Other software, such as BOSS, has similar functionality.

Most agencies have encountered little difficulty in providing this information (see below). In a small number of cases, an agency has interpreted items A1-A4 as requesting the creation of a record that does not exist. We disagree: this data is maintained by your software, can be exported through software your agency has already purchased, and is therefore subject to CPRA.

However, should you disagree, you may alternatively produce the following records:

A5. All agreements, memoranda of understanding, requests, or other certifying documents that external agencies have signed to comply with Sec 1798.90.52(b) for accessing your agency's ALPR data. These documents are also often required under the "Releasing ALPR Data" subsection of a California law enforcement agency's SB 34 policy.
A6. All agreements, memoranda of understanding, requests, or other certifying documents that your agency has signed pursuant to Sec 1798.90.52(b) to access other agencies' ALPR data.
A7. All "records of access" required by Sec. 1798.90.52(a) for the periods January 1, 2024 until the date of processing this request.

Items A5-A7 are not necessary if your agency provides the information requested in items A1-A4. We feel that items A1-A4 are more focused and would require less labor from your agency to produce. 

Part B - Information Related to Numbers of “Detections” (plate scans) and “Hits” (plate scans that matched to a hotlist)

B1. The aggregate number of "detections" collected during 2024 and 2025.
B2. The aggregate number of “hits” during 2024 and 2025.
B3. The aggregate number of "detections" from January 1, 2024 until the date this request is processed. If your agency has a retention period shorter than 1 year, please provide whatever data is available based on your retention period. For example, most Flock Safety systems may not have this data beyond 30 days.
B4. The aggregate number of “hits” from January 1, 2024 until the date this request is processed. If your agency has a retention period shorter than 1 year, please provide whatever data is available based on your retention period.

The information requested in items B1-B4 is readily available through the ALPR software you use. For example, with Vigilant Solutions/Motorola Solutions, this data can be exported easily using the Hit Ratio Report function. With Flock Safety, this information is available through the transparency portal function. Other software, such as BOSS, has similar functionality. As noted above, this information exists within your system and can be easily exported with existing software.

Part C - Assistance, Description, and Recommendations.

We make the following requests under section 6253.1 of the California Public Records Act

C1. A description of the information technology and physical location in which the records exist.
C2. Assist us identifying records and information that will help the public understand how ALPR data and hotlists are shared, how much data is collected year-to-year, and how much of that data matches a hot list; and
C3. Provide suggestions for overcoming any practical basis for denying access to the information sought.

Please note that more than 80 California law enforcement agencies, including yours, have provided the information requested in Parts A1-A4 and B1-B4 in previous years.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Drew Fillen

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Clyde R Appleton's FBI file i s referenced at the Arizona Historical Society in Tucson AZ.   I wish to see when the file was begun and for what reasons. Sincerely,

Theodore Warmbrand

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: BPD District Community CompStat Presentations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to G.L. c. 66, § 10, I request copies of all Community CompStat presentations prepared, displayed, or distributed by the Boston Police Department at Community CompStat meetings in any district during August and September 2025.

This request is an expansion of my prior request for the District E-13 Community CompStat presentation (August 26, 2025), which the Department fulfilled in full and which is now public via MuckRock: https://www.muckrock.com/foi/boston-3/bpd-district-e-13-community-compstat-presentation-aug-26-2025-192111/. That prior release confirms that such presentation materials are regularly prepared, used, and subject to disclosure under the Public Records Law.

By way of example, additional Community CompStat presentations were held in District D-4 (South End) on Aug 27th, and in other districts citywide during this August and September 2025 time period.  Feel free to exclude the Aug 26 E-13 presentation that has already been provided if it makes it easier for you. 

Please provide the complete presentation materials (e.g., PowerPoint, slide deck, PDF, or other format) as displayed at each meeting.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: B002529-091025
communications.communication:
Dear Brian McCarter 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Boston Police Department. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 9/10/2025 10:36:27 PM and given the reference number B002529-091025 for tracking purposes. 
If this is a media request, please contact the Office of Media Relations directly at 617.343.4520. 
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to G.L. c. 66, § 10, I request copies of all Community CompStat presentations prepared, displayed, or distributed by the Boston Police Department at Community CompStat meetings in any district during August and September 2025.

This request is an expansion of my prior request for the District E-13 Community CompStat presentation (August 26, 2025), which the Department fulfilled in full and which is now public via MuckRock: https://www.muckrock.com/foi/boston-3/bpd-district-e-13-community-compstat-presentation-aug-26-2025-192111/. That prior release confirms that such presentation materials are regularly prepared, used, and subject to disclosure under the Public Records Law.

By way of example, additional Community CompStat presentations were held in District D-4 (South End) on Aug 27th, and in other districts citywide during this August and September 2025 time period. Feel free to exclude the Aug 26 E-13 presentation that has already been provided if it makes it easier for you.

Please provide the complete presentation materials (e.g., PowerPoint, slide deck, PDF, or other format) as displayed at each meeting.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fboston-police-department-174%252Fbpd-district-community-compstat-presentations-192859%252F%253Femail%253Dshawn.williams%252540boston.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj3ZGMpK7GcwjUUAUtBlYljwA%3A1uwX9M%3AOqyDOJwFY5-o7QvGli04IOsRJRDZDwIluBgxqeyrgNs

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Test Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All records and materials related to facial recognition technology, including software, hardware, services, and systems, whether developed internally, procured from vendors, or accessed through agreements with other entities (e.g., other agencies, fusion centers, private companies). This includes, but is not limited to, the following:

*   **Inventory and Status:**
    *   Any records identifying the number, type, and current status (e.g., in use, pilot, testing, under consideration, discontinued) of all facial recognition technology.
    *   Documentation specifying if the technology has been purchased, developed internally, or if services are performed by outside contractors or accessed via third-party agreements.
    *   Records detailing where facial recognition technology is deployed or utilized, including but not limited to, county jails, body-worn cameras, fixed surveillance cameras, or mobile devices.

*   **Acquisition and Financial Records:**
    *   Requests for Information (RFIs), Requests for Proposals (RFPs), invitations for bids, bid responses, sole-source or limited-source justification and approval documentation, and other procurement materials.
    *   All contracts, licensing agreements, service agreements, intergovernmental service agreements, memorandums of understanding (MOUs), data sharing agreements, non-disclosure agreements, and any amendments or exhibits thereto.
    *   Purchase orders, invoices, budget allocations, funding opportunity announcements, grant applications, and grantor status/progress reports related to facial recognition technology.

*   **Policies and Operational Procedures:**
    *   All existing or proposed policies, directives, guidance documents, protocols, and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) governing the use, acquisition, deployment, data handling, and oversight of facial recognition technology.
    *   Records addressing permissible and prohibited activities, legal standards required for use, data storage procedures, and data retention guidelines.

*   **Training and Personnel Records:**
    *   All instructional materials, user guides, handbooks, technical manuals, presentations, videos, and certification records for any personnel authorized to operate or access facial recognition technology.
    *   Any documents or records related to training on bias in the use of facial recognition technology, accuracy, or ethical considerations.
    *   Lists, rosters, or logs of all personnel (e.g., officers, analysts, staff) who have been trained on, certified in, granted access to, or have used facial recognition technology.

*   **Usage and Performance Data:**
    *   All audit logs for facial recognition systems from [START DATE] to [END DATE, or PRESENT DATE]. If the system provides options for time period granularity, provide daily or weekly reports.
    *   All reports detailing aggregated usage/transaction statistics for facial recognition systems from [START DATE] to [END DATE, or PRESENT DATE], including (but not limited to) the number of queries, number of daily users, and number of photographs/facial templates uploaded to the database. If the system provides options for time period granularity, provide daily reports.
    *   Any documents (including screenshots of program dashboards) detailing the total number of photographs or facial templates included in the database(s) linked to facial recognition systems as of [END DATE, or PRESENT DATE].
    *   Documents sufficient to describe the source of photos or facial templates for the facial recognition databases (e.g., booking photos from this agency, booking photos from other agencies, DMV photos, publicly available images, social media).
    *   Any validation studies, accuracy reports, reliability assessments, performance evaluations, or audits (internal or external) conducted on facial recognition technology.

*   **Legal and Accountability Records:**
    *   Copies of any notices of potential legal action (e.g., intent to sue letters), formal legal complaints, or settlement documents regarding cases of alleged misidentification, false arrest, or other claims arising from the use of facial recognition technology. This should include both open and closed civil lawsuits.
    *   Any privacy impact assessments, security audits, or reports to legislative or oversight bodies concerning facial recognition technology.

*   **Technical and Marketing Information:**
    *   Technical documentation, specification documents, architecture diagrams, emails, handouts, PowerPoint presentations, advertisements, or other materials describing the function and capabilities of the facial recognition software or equipment.
    *   All marketing materials (solicited or unsolicited) acquired from vendors of facial recognition technology.
    *   Any algorithms, source code (including original source code, compiled binaries/executables, program scripts), or detailed explanations of how the software's calculations or decision-making processes work.
    *   Description of input and output data fields for the software, along with a copy of the five most recent sets of data that were used for input and the five most recent outputs of the software, in their native format (redacted for exempt information as required by law).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sanjin Ibrahimovic

communications.subject: Request Acknowledgement - AF 2025-07952-F
communications.communication:
Dear Alan Segal Segal, 
This is to acknowledge receipt of your September 10, 2025, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request for "1) All procurement materials associated with procurement identifier number FA714624C0019 with Anomaly 6 LLC2) All marketing materials, system manuals, and user guides from Anomaly 6 (sometimes referred to Anomaly Six) relating to their platform." (Date Range for Record Search: From 01/01/2014 To 09/10/2025). Based on our initial review, we believe we cannot process your request within the statutory 20 workdays because our organization has a significant number of pending FOIA requests.  To ensure all requesters are properly served in the order their requests were received, we have instituted multitrack processing of requests.  Based on the information you provided, we have placed your request in the complex track. The Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) provides for the collection of fees based on the costs of processing a FOIA request and your fee category.  Based upon the information provided in your request, we have placed you in the Other category. We have assigned number 2025-07952-F to identify your request; should you need to contact us about your request.  Please direct your questions to the HAF FOIA team at SAF.AA.HAF.FOIA.Workflow@us.af.mil and use this assigned number to assist us in responding more promptly. We will strive to provide an update between 90 and 120 days.  Our policy is to process requests within their respective tracks in the order in which they were received in accordance with 32 CFR, Part 286.8.  We will notify you in writing if additional processing time is required.  We do process each FOIA request as quickly as possible, however delayed responses can be expected. Very Respectfully, SAF/AMGI FOIA TEAM Office of the Secretary of the Air Force 1000 Air Force Pentagon Washington, DC 20330-1000

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Group chats city council
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

To: Records Access Officer, 

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, G.L. c. 66, § 10, I hereby request the following records:

Scope of Request
All electronic communications from January 1, 2024 through the present that meet all of the following criteria:

1. Participants: The communication included five (5) or more members of the Boston City Council, whether or not other individuals also participated.


2. Platform: The communication occurred via any messaging platform, including but not limited to SMS text, iMessage, Signal, WhatsApp, Telegram, GroupMe, Slack, Microsoft Teams, Facebook Messenger, Instagram, or any other chat or messaging application capable of group communication and/or self-destructing messages.


3. Subject Matter: The communication concerned City Council business, including business before the full Council or any Council committee.


Retention and Policy Records
In addition, please provide:

Any policies, instructions, or notices regarding the retention, deletion, or suppression of text messages, encrypted chat communications, or group messaging applications by City Councilors or their staff.

Any logs, records, or metadata showing when responsive communications were deleted, auto-deleted, or otherwise rendered unavailable


Format and Preservation

This request covers group text messages, encrypted chat logs, group messages with self-destructing or timed deletion features, or other comparable communications, regardless of whether sent from personal or City-issued devices/accounts.

Records should include the content of the communication, the identities of participants, and metadata showing dates and times.

If any responsive records have been deleted or auto-deleted, please confirm whether any logs, retention notices, or preservation policies exist relating to those communications.


Standard Verification and Format Instructions
If no responsive records exist for a given item, please confirm that no such records exist.
Please identify the custodians and systems searched, and describe the methods used to locate responsive records.
If responsive records include databases, spreadsheets, or summary logs, please provide them in a machine-readable format (e.g., .csv or Excel).
Please include any available metadata showing dates of record creation, sender, and recipient, where applicable.
If responsive records exist in draft or revised form, please include those versions as well.
Please include any policies, notices, or instructions to staff regarding the handling, retention, deletion, or suppression of relevant reports or records.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

title: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of July 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of July 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

title: Library Contract Request: Gale General OneFile

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Library Contract Request: Gale General OneFile
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with Gale relating to the licensing of Gale's General OneFile;
1)  All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and
2)  All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the contractual relations with Gale for database licensing.

Please do not limit your search to strictly direct agreements or renewals between the State Library of Oregon and the vendor (Gale), but include all agreements and related documentation that provide access to this licensed material for Authorized Users affiliated with Central Oregon Community College.

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of Gale’s General OneFile.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Ellen Dubinsky

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Dear FOIA Officer,

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act, 5 ILCS 140, I request access to and copies of the following records:

Metadata from the property inventory system underlying the property seizure/forfeiture Form 4-64, including the following fields for all property inventoried between January 1, 2001 and the present:

Recovered date
RD number
Inventory number
ID number
Description of property
Inventory type
IUCR code
State charges
Beat of recovery
Status (e.g., hold for investigation, property available for return to owner, to be disposed of, etc.)
Statute
Statute description
Whether or not the property is in CPD possession
I request that the responsive records be provided in CSV or Excel format if available, or another machine-readable format.

If you determine that portions of the requested records are exempt from disclosure under FOIA, please provide the non-exempt portions and cite the specific statutory exemption(s) justifying the redaction or withholding.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

RE: FOIA Request of September 09, 2025, Reference # R080796-090925 

Dear Filed Requests, 
Thank you for contacting the Cook County Sheriff's Office ("CCSO") pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act ("FOIA"), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. (2012). 
Your request mentioned: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

Dear FOIA Officer, 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act, 5 ILCS 140, I request access to and copies of the following records: 

Metadata from the property inventory system underlying the property seizure/forfeiture Form 4-64, including the following fields for all property inventoried between January 1, 2001 and the present: 

Recovered date 
RD number 
Inventory number 
ID number 
Description of property 
Inventory type 
IUCR code 
State charges 
Beat of recovery 
Status (e.g., hold for investigation, property available for return to owner, to be disposed of, etc.) 
Statute 
Statute description 
Whether or not the property is in CPD possession 
I request that the responsive records be provided in CSV or Excel format if available, or another machine-readable format. 

If you determine that portions of the requested records are exempt from disclosure under FOIA, please provide the non-exempt portions and cite the specific statutory exemption(s) justifying the redaction or withholding. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Filed Requests

title: Johann "Jack" Unterweger FBI File - previously unprocessed documents

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Johann "Jack" Unterweger FBI File - previously unprocessed documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Page 25 of the previously released file associated with FOIPA Request No.: 1677982-000 Subject: UNTERWEGER, JOHANN (August 16, 1950 – June 29, 1994) is a Memo dated 5/10/1993 that references enclosures that were not included in the previously released documents. The Memo contains copies of "Profil" articles faxed to LSU on 4/21/93. The articles were both original copies and English translations. I have attached this Memo for you to reference. I would like to please request these Memo attachments.

I have already been sent prior releases and/or pre-processed files, but would be interested in any additional files you come across in your search. Please kindly conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, however as noted below, please inform me prior to performing any searches incurring fees.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Elizabeth J Klein

title: FBI File(s) on the late journalist Ross Gelbspan

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI File(s) on the late journalist Ross Gelbspan
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all segregable and releasable FBI records pertaining to the deceased journalist ROSS GELBSPAN (Born: 1939; Date of Death: January 27, 2024) who spent 31 years as a reporter and editor at various newspapers, including The Philadelphia Bulletin, The Washington Post, the Village Voice and The Boston Globe. Obituaries on Gelbspan can be seen at The New York Times; The Washington Post and Legacy.com.

- https://www.nytimes.com/2024/02/16/business/media/ross-gelbspan-dead.html
- https://www.washingtonpost.com/obituaries/2024/02/17/ross-gelbspan-climate-journalist-dies/
- https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/bostonglobe/name/ross-gelbspan-obituary?id=54265222

This search is to include each of the following record stores and interfaces: the Central Records System (CRS), the Automated Case Support system ("ACS"), Investigative Case Management system ("ICM"), the Automated Case Support system ("ACS"), Electronic Case File ("ECF"), and the Automated Case Support system ("ACS") Universal Index ("UNI").

I also request a search of "ELSUR", the database containing electronic surveillance information, for any and all records or activities related to Gelbspan for any on-line account or address or associated service. In addition, please extend the search criteria across any external storage media, including I-Drives, S-Drives, or related technologies used during the course of investigation. Please include processing notes, even if this request is denied in part. Please identify individuals responsible for any aspect of FOIA processing in the processing notes, along with explanation of their involvement if not typically assigned FOIA responsibilities for the record systems above. Please include materials responsive to this request from the bureau's Massachusetts field offices, if possible, to reduce overlap with field office requests.

Note, also: I am a freelance reporter and would request that any relevant fees be waived. My past work has appeared in The Daily Mail, The New York Times, New York magazine's Intelligencer blog, Scientific American, Slate.com, the New Republic, the New York Review of Books, Chemical Engineering magazine, and elsewhere.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Phelan

title: Library Contract Request: ProQuest Ebook Central (Northwest Arkansas Community College)

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Library Contract Request: ProQuest Ebook Central (Northwest Arkansas Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with Clarivate / ProQuest relating to the licensing of ProQuest Ebook Central;
All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and
All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the contractual relations with Clarivate / ProQuest for ebook licensing.

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of ProQuest Ebook Central.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with smhc.
